customer_reviews.title: Sharp as a tack. These feel heavy and sturdy, but they're not. Read review
customer_reviews.text: The actual barrel that the mount base (stainless steel) mounts to is an engineering plastic. So even though it feels and looks all-metal, it's not. And an important piece is breakable plastic inside. The lens will separate from the mount if any hit is taken by the lens and that in-turn tears the flex cables, making a repair an expensive proposition. All in all though, it goes head to head with L-glass for sharpness, bokeh and light gathering. Wish it were a bit more of a range as 18-35 is pretty damn limiting at times.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I rented this first to test it out and was blown away by the photos I was getting on my Canon 70D then purchased it immediately. Forget carry a bunch of lenses around. This is basically a bunch of primes in one. I ended up selling my 2 kit lenses, 40mm STM and 50mm f1.8 as this lens replaced them all. Just add good zoom lens to your arsenal and you have everything you need to take awesome photos!
customer_reviews.author: Tamora

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. I use it for all my vacation travels and don't even use my walk around lens anymore. It's super clear and the contrast is good. It's so fast that it's great for low light. This is basically permanently affixed to my canon 60d when i go anywhere. Indoors low light, it helps capture a small room, outdoor and sunny and it's great for capturing landscapes or buildings. I'm debating on buying a canon 5m mirrorless when it comes out and an adapter, instead of moving to another brand because this lens, I really don't want to give it up.
customer_reviews.author: D. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good!
customer_reviews.text: Not the best for portrait photography, but it's solid for cameras that arent full frame! The autofocus is great! Video wise this is the lens to go. Photos, it could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Campos

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for Canon 70d
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting this lens for a long time and was not disappointed when received. I can't believe how sharp the pictures are and the nice bokah it provides. Do note that you want to do a focusing test and adjustment because I heard that these lens may need them, so if you get it and it is front/rear focusing do the adjustments or send it in with your camera body to get adjusted. Once it is adjusted for your camera you will be amazed how the pictures look.
customer_reviews.author: B. Tran

customer_reviews.title: The constant aperture and the lens' clarity are phenomenal. ...
customer_reviews.text: The constant aperture and the lens' clarity are phenomenal. The only two drawbacks are the focal length and lack of image stabilization, but the lack of these features is well worth the price point — especially if you do a lot of model or concert photography and have steady hands. At f/1.8, image stabilization isn't a problem because it brings in a lot of light; either way, find a way to keep your shutter speed above 1/200 and stability shouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 months in this is my go to lens
customer_reviews.text: Buying used is a great way to save some money and in this case I didn't sacrifice a shred of quality. This is the lens that is on my camera the most. It's super sharp and I love the fact that I get a very shallow depth of field (f1.8) in a zoom. This is much better than the nifty 50 for apsc cameras. The only downside, if you consider it one is the lens has some heft to it, but it's also a mark of the quality that went into it.
customer_reviews.author: wile-e-coyote

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Focus - Not compatible with canon 60D
customer_reviews.text: The lens is not compatible with 60D as is mentioned in the description. It does not focus and is not what i was expecting from all the reviews that are here.
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: Prime quality with the flexibility of adjustable lenses!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 50mm prime f1.4 lens, and a 17-55mm f2.8 lens stolen out of my car. I loved (and needed) them both, and was not looking forward to the cost of replacing them... I was hesitant that this lens would replace them both, but I actually like it BETTER due to the flexibility it has. I don't miss either of my old lenses at all now that I have this.
customer_reviews.author: Joelrunner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens for glidecam/steadycam work.
customer_reviews.text: Man, I cannot praise this lense enough. It is just such a great zoom range for most things, and especially for video production. This thing is amazing on a steadicam/glidecam. The balance barely gets thrown off when zooming and is easy to correct. The ability to open to 1.8 is such an amazing help. While filming a wedding I was so glad to have this fast of a lens and for such a great price. Pros: Sharp! Internal zoom Solid as a rock! Very fast. Little to no lens flares Cons: Not a big fan of the end cap. Doesn't go on very easily. Some may say the price, but I think the price is justified No Vibration compensation
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: Heavy.  But manageable
customer_reviews.text: Pretty heavy. Takes great pics. Works best at at a smaller fstop like 2.2 or “higher”. Does a great job at lifestyle photography as well as portrait. I don’t seem to get too much distortion up close. My number one lens at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: ashley rippeon

customer_reviews.title: not professional photographer
customer_reviews.text: I'm not professional photographer so this review is from someone who wants a blurry background in a medium sized room (3.5 mt/ 11.4 ft) for YT videos the easy way with minimal fuss- and this lens does jus that and Im happy with it. It's heavy but my gorillapod works fine with it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Zahrani

customer_reviews.title: My new all purpose lens, but adding a 90D.
customer_reviews.text: Found this lens at the last minute, to shoot a wedding with my old Canon 60D. It’s amazing! Hand held shots during Mass, 800 ISO at f3.2 and sharp as can be. Used the 18-35 for 95% of my event.👍
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: I have heard that this was a nice lens, but my specific models focus ring was ...
customer_reviews.text: I have heard that this was a nice lens, but my specific models focus ring was malfunctioning. At one time it was smooth with quite a bit of tension, but after using the AF in my camera, if I had switched to manual focus, then the focus ring was not that responsive. I don't think that this is necessarily a bad lens, but I think I got a defective product. (using a Canon​ 80D)
customer_reviews.author: Arjun Amisagadda

customer_reviews.title: Best for landscape, not portrait
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens overall, I used it at the Grand Canyon for stunning photos. Not great in low light situations. Meh for portrait. Good depth of field, nice and wide for landscapes. I used it in 16:9 photos, and the daylight photos turned out really nicely.
customer_reviews.author: David Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at buying several prime lenses and started reviewing this as an option. I am super happy I did. The lens is super fast, has better color capture and a great improvement over the kit lens. The only thing is that it is heavy. But that being said you can definitely tell it is well made.
customer_reviews.author: John Lehmann

customer_reviews.title: Versatility
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I tested this lens with my Canon EOS SL2 and worked great! I still need testing it with other cameras, like the Canon M50 and the Sony A7III with Sigma MC-11 adapter, so I will update, but I love it! Very nice pictures out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime E. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: The Money Lens!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is absolutely amazing and guaranteed to make your photos and videos crispy. It has an extremely fast and quiet auto focus, it also fits perfectly in my camera bag. I highly recommend this lens to anyone that shoots photography or films videos for YouTube. You surely won’t regret purchasing this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Hemifam

customer_reviews.title: One of the best lenses out there
customer_reviews.text: So far this lens has been everything I've been dreaming about for past two years. Image is Sharp, the build quality is top notch it's really solid I'd say about a pound and half of weight. Just well made, great image. I use this strictly for video. If you're looking to take your filming to next level and maybe like me you can't afford a $2,000-$3,000 camera this lens will help.
customer_reviews.author: spl42Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Best Available Lens For Night And Indoor
customer_reviews.text: Using this lens for indoor, street, night portrait and day portrait photography is fantastic. You can get a pretty wide panorama at 28mm equiv. if you need it, and 50mm equiv. with incredible brightness and bokeh for portraits. The AF is lightning fast in all but the darkest scenarios and it's nearly silent. The lens is a bit heavy but clearly well built and easy to use, with the focus rings gliding effortlessly. Have used for personal nighttime shoots and professional nighttime and indoor shoots, and the quality is incredible even paired with a simple Canon T3i.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens. Best lens for crop frame camera's
customer_reviews.text: I looooooove it. Amazing lens. Best lens for crop frame camera's. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Bonilla López

customer_reviews.title: BEST OPEN APERATURE ZOOM LENS.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to fit on my Canon EOS m50 with a Canon EF - EF-M lens adapter. Produces pretty sharp images around f/2, unfortunately the autofocusing on this lens makes a little noise and the in body microphone in the Canon EOS m50 would pick up the sound. But other than that, perfect portrait lens.
customer_reviews.author: Trinh Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp across the frame even at f1.8. f4 is sharp corner to corner. Only downside is the seller I received this from sent an international version with NO WARRANTY. Be aware If you see them going for around $639 you may receive the same.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: great quality, but TOO HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: the lens has very good construction quality, the photos are great, the 1.8 blur is fascinating. The bad thing is the weight and it usually has focus problems in some cameras. In my d5500 it was a headache to get the focus right, not so in the d7500
customer_reviews.author: Adrian costa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price. Slow and audible auto-focus, though
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for 3 months now. The photos are incredibly sharp. I have to say however that this lens doesn't have image stabilization but I knew it when I bought the item. That's easily fixable with a rig. What I do find as a small pet peeve is that the lens is slow to auto-focus and makes sound that is clearly audible when I take videos. It's a small fault in the lens and, for the price, I think this is the greatest aperture and length for those starting out in film making and want an all-rounder.
customer_reviews.author: KieuLy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Best lens I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best built, best performing, and best looking lens I've ever owned. I saved up months to purchase this item and I'm so glad that I did. The pictures are amazing and the aperture is fantastic for bokeh. The only downsides are the zoom, if it had a larger zoom I'd say this would be the only lens I needed. I have tried it in low lighting, but have not tried it out for stargazing shots. I plan on taking more pictures with this lens soon and I will update my review with what I find. So far I would say this lens is a must buy!
customer_reviews.author: tman5890

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, shipped without a lens cap
customer_reviews.text: The lens is great! Good build quality and really sharp. I’m using it with an adapter on my Sony a6500, so I’m not sure if I’m getting the full potential of the autofocus, but it’s a great lens for an amazing price. Only one issue, I bought it used, and it was in fantastic condition, but it didn’t come with a lens cap. Other than that, it’s a fantastic lens for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best lens in my bag. The Sigma 24/70 art is the second best!
customer_reviews.author: Travis McGhee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing!!!! I’m no professional and I just use it for personal use, but it works soooo easily! I use both the manual and auto focus and I just love it! Focus is better on manual focus but still, so great!
customer_reviews.author: Piueti

product_meta.title: Sigma 18-35mm F1.8 DC HSM Lens for Canon - Black
product_meta.description:
Style Name:18-35 mm LensSIGMA 18-35mm F1.8 DC HSM is the first zoom lens ever to achieve a maximum aperture of f1.8 throughout the zoom range. It is a wide aperture, standard zoom-lens for digital single lens reflex camera's with APS-C size sensor's. The lens has a focal range equivalent to 27mm - 52.5mm in a 35mm format and it can cover the angles of view of multiple fixed focal length lenses. This wide aperture, standard zoom lens enables the photographer to expand creative possibilities on any occasion.

 Our Art line delivers high-level artistic quality Sigma is organizing all its interchangeable lenses into three product lines; Contemporary, Art and Sports. Designed with a focus on sophisticated optical performance and abundant expressive power, our Art line delivers high-level artistic expression. Developed with the maximum emphasis on artistic touch, they are designed to meet the expectations of users who value a creative, dramatic outcome above compactness and multifunction. Along with landscapes, portraits, still-life, close-up and casual snaps, they are perfect for the kind of photography that unleashes the inner artist. Ideal for studio photography, they offer just as much expressive scope when capturing architecture, starry skies, underwater shots and many other scenes. 

 Excellent Usability A zoom lens is very convenient as it offers various angles of view just by rotating the zoom ring. However, the down side was that no zoom lens ever offered a faster aperture than f2.8 which led photographers to select fixed focal length lenses for brighter images. While the aperture value of prime lenses is superior to zoom lenses, their field of view is always the same, and therefore it was always necessary to carry many fixed focal length lenses. SIGMA 18-35mm F1.8 DC HSM is a new generation lens that can deliver images at f1.8 aperture throughout its focal length. The bright viewfinder is very helpful for checking the focus and composition of the image. If it is compared with a lens of F2.8, the faster shutter speed and the shallow depth of field of F1.8 further expands creativity. From wide to standard range this lens offers the excellent versatility and performance of multiple fixed focal length lenses. 

 Fruit of cutting edge technology To achieve a wide zoom lens with a maximum aperture of f1.8, various technical problems need to be overcome. As the aperture value gets larger, the depth of focus becomes shallower, thus it makes the lens design extremely complicated in order to compensate for various distortions, such as spherical, axial chromatic and astigmatic aberration along with curvature of field. In order to compensate for astigmatic aberration across the entire focal range, we have relied on the experience and know how gained when designing our super wide angle zoom lenses such as SIGMA12-24mm F4.5-5.6 II DG HSM and SIGMA 8-16mm F4.5-5.6 DC HSM. In addition, the technological innovation at our Aizu factory also contributes to better lens production. It has enabled us to develop a wide glass-molded aspheric lens, and the incorporation of SLD (Special Low Dispersion) glass has optimized power distribution of the optical elements and compensated for various aberrations as well as curvature of field at the widest angle. Thanks to our knowledge of lens design accumulated over a long period of time plus the latest lens manufacturing techniques, SIGMA has finally made the dream of a zoom lens with F1.8 throughout its entire focal range come true. 

 Convenient handling Convenient handling is achieved by incorporating internal focusing and zooming which prevents any change in the length of the lens when focusing and zooming. It is possible to use a specialist filter, such as a Circular Polarizer, as the front part of the lens does not rotate. 

 Designed to minimize flare and ghosting Flare and ghosting were thoroughly measured and monitored from an early stage in the lenses development to establish an optical design which is resistant to strong incidental light such as backlight. The Super Multi-Layer Coating reduces flare and ghosting and provides sharp and high contrast images even in backlit conditions. Attaching the matched petal type hood, which is supplied, will provide extra protection from flare and ghosting. 

 Minimum focusing distance of 28cm With a minimum focusing distance of 28cm and a maximum magnification ratio of 1:4.3, this lens is excellent for close-up photography. 

 Hyper Sonic Motor The HSM (Hyper Sonic Motor) ensures a silent, high-speed AF function. Optimizing AF algorithm, smoother AF is achieved. It also enables full-time manual focusing capability which allows sensible focus adjustment by simply rotating the focus ring. 

 Incorporating Rounded diaphragm The 9 blade rounded diaphragm creates an attractive round bokeh at large-aperture settings.

BOX CONTAINS
